description: html: be able to test more than one testdata file.

messages.text:
Hello andybalholm@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/5351041/diff/4001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go
File src/pkg/html/parse_test.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5351041/diff/4001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go#newcode129
src/pkg/html/parse_test.go:129: testFiles := []struct {
Would it be better to store this data outside the TestParser function? Usually test case data is stored in globals.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5351041/diff/4001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go
File src/pkg/html/parse_test.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5351041/diff/4001/src/pkg/html/parse_test.go#newcode129
src/pkg/html/parse_test.go:129: testFiles := []struct {
On 2011/11/04 15:48:03, andybalholm wrote:
> Would it be better to store this data outside the TestParser function? Usually
> test case data is stored in globals.

I often have test data as local, if it doesn't need to be global. It lets you have two different tests on two different data sets without needing two longer names.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=f765fc67d6df ***

html: be able to test more than one testdata file.
